text:
Went to try this resto because of the stellar reviews... wasn't really wowwed by the food. It was okay. I guess... I was expecting more? 

It wasn't bad or anything but I don't think it warranted a five stars rating. I didn't really try a lot of their food but the ones I've tried were just okay. 

Their banchan only consisted of three small dishes... kimchi, veggie pancake, miso soup. The kimchi tasted very generic... not the usual fermented kimchi I get from other Korean restos. 

The chicken wasn't cooked well. It was still pinkish. The eel was very bony. The mixed veggie rice, at least, was good. However, it made me crave for some protein, like fish etc. However, almost everything in their menu is a set. If I wanted protein to eat with the mixed veggie rice... I'd have to order a complete teriyaki salmon bento set. Not very convenient.

Furthermore... It was kinda expensive... especially for what we ordered. I think it would have been better for us to go to an AYCE sushi. 

I'm surprised they don't have dolsot bibimbap in their menu. I won't come back.

Well Being in a Box was on a list of restaurants I was going to hit up in Las Vegas.

It is a small restaurant of ten tables full of kitschy Asian decorations- from the paper Asian lanterns to the paintings of Korean court dancers on the wall.  We were warmly greeted upon entering and waited on immediately.

My husband is generally leery of Asian restaurants because he hates that they serve a $3 cans of Coke when you always need a refill.  So when he noticed the soda fountain, he was a more willing patron.  

The location is convenient since we were staying at the Imperial Palace on the Strip.  We noticed A LOT of Korean patrons when we were there and figured that if the food can pass the litmus test of a native Korean, the food has to be good.  Another plus is the lack of loud, cheesy Korean music videos that can be found in some restaurants.  (I don't discriminate among Asian videos.  I loathe them all!  I am Chinese and I hate on the Chinese videos as well, especially since Aaron Kwok was in Vegas at the same time.  I did not appreciate the audio-visual assault of his performance on the Wynn jumbotron on my eyes and ears.)

I ordered the beef bulgogi box with all the fixins.  The radish, kimchee and the ginger that came with it was awesome.  There was also a green salad, mac salad and California rolls that came in the box.  The beef was tasty and seasoned just right.  The food surpasses in price and in quality to the other Korean food that we have had (Ginger 3 in Imperial Palace).  The food was cheap and it gave us more money to go gambling later that night!
Best asian cuisine I ever had, fast service,  very friendly staff. The food was fresh and delicious.

My wif we and I came here last month. The food was so great and the service was super friendly.  Then we came back again today and our expectation was blown off the roof!  The spicy Kalb soup was rich in flavors with fresh vegetables.  The place felt like home with friendly service again.  I recommend everyone to try out the Korean and Japanese sushi!  It is the best in Las Vegas!

Great sushi but usually  take too long to get food out, Their  waitress is fantastic! 

Try the wellbeing roll

I've been here quite a few times, permitting I'm in the area. I've always been satisfied with everything. Service is always friendly and fast; the food is always fresh and delicious. They definitely give you your money's worth and I look forward to trying all the great food I'm served. I always look forward to returning here.
A small but tidy restaurant with friendly staff. Always served quickly and taken care of by the waiters. Not an extraordinary place but definitely hits the spot for a udon soup or ramen fix!

Best Korean Food in town! You can also get great Sushi as well. Katsu has that great korean style taste to it becasue of the sauce and the dragon roll is simply superb~ Everything from the food and to the price is simply unbeatable in the Vegas area. This place is a "must dine" resturant for locals. Also, anyone from out of town after a long night of drinking should consider this place to chase hangovers korean style :)

This is always a great fall back place for us. Love the kalbi box and the sushi is pretty good too. We usually always pick up and eat at the house but it is nice to eat at the restaurant because they bring nice snacks to the table like kimchi.
One star up!!! Last Saturday I ordered the sashimi bowl with rice to go. Fantastic! !!!
Excellent service.  Spicy kalbi soup is delicious.  Sushi is ok but the Korean food is more their strength.  Check it out.

This place was a very pleasant surprise. A friend suggested it as a meeting place for lunch.  I was leery because I don't eat sushi. The food is great & the service is amazing! I had the BBQ combo lunch special.  The only thing I wasn't thrilled with is that the kimchi isn't as spicy as I'm used to.  That's my only complaint, but they did provide me with sriracha. Nice, friendly staff & really good food.  I've been back multiple times for lunch.  Great little find is recommend to anyone.  I've heard the sushi is good too, but I'm still not willing to try it.
I love this place. My family and I frequent it. I love the bibimbap and the kimchi fried rice. They have great sushi also!

Well Being in the Box is a great place to eat. The food is delicious and the people there are nice. I had the spicy fried rice which was excellent, so good I even bought some of their homemade hot sauce to take with me.

I ate here just a few nights ago. The food was pretty good and the staff was very friendly. Be warned, it doesn't say so on the menu, but the Tofu Soup contains beef. I didn't know that when I ordered mine. Our waitress clearly felt bad about that and offered to replace it. I refused, since the rest of my party was almost done eating. She took the soup off the bill and insisted on bringing me free desert. I'll definitely come back.

This hidden treasure is a true gem. My daughter wanted sushi for her birthday dinner and we went to a nearby restaurant we had been wanting to try. When we arrived we found out they changed the menu and no longer serve sushi. Not wanting to be rude we ordered an appetizer and drinks, planning on going somewhere else for sushi afterward. We saw this place across the parking lot but by the time we finished out appetizer at the other place and walked over they were closing up. My daughter looked sad and the chef simply opened back up and made her whatever she wanted. She had three different rolls I think. The chef came to the table to ask questions and make sure he got her exactly what she wanted for her birthday dinner. The woman working the counter was really gracious and welcoming. We have lived within walking distance of this place for over three years and had never tried it before. Now that we have, we will be regulars. What a shame we missed out for so long. The sushi was excellent and we are looking forward to trying the rest of the menu. Thank you guys for saving the birthday!

Came here to try it out after seeing so many great Yelp reviews. We ended up disappointed. 

I had the tofu soup. It was not very flavorful. The broth seemed watered down and though it was spicy it lacked salt and didn't feel hearty.

My husband had the sashimi salad. The fish was OK, but not super fresh. It was mediocre.

The pancake side dish was too doughy and not as good as others I have had. The Kimchi was the best part of the meal, but seemed like it hadn't marinated long. 

The servers were very friendly and attentive. And the tea was good!

Bottom line is I wouldn't come back.

Visited Well Being In The Box on the 4th of July. Simply put, it was a firecracker of flavor (how's that for a timely use of verbiage?!). I ordered the chicken bento which was meal and a half. This included miso, pancake, kimchi, pickled garlic and jalapeno in soy along with cucumber, macaroni and green salads, California roll and of course, chicken! I was even offered a dessert which was politely declined (I was stuffed!). 

You're probably wondering how much this cost. How about $10.95! Can you believe it? I also ordered a perfect iced tea which was promptly refilled by a super server. For the life of me, I can't remember her name - but she's amazing!

The restaurant is under new ownership and it shows! The quality of food and attention to service is obvious. The portions and price only add to this. 

Stop by and see for yourself!

UPDATE- This is NOT a sushi restaurant.  We went there yesterday for sushi after finding it on Yelp.  The menu did not have a sushi section, but it did have a selection of "Hand Rolls".  We ordered a few, what we got were some cut rolls that were mostly rice with a little bit of not very fresh fish.  While we were waiting, another couple came in and said to the server "We want to order some sushi to go", he explained that they had just changed their menu last week and no more sushi.  Oh well.  We were in the mood for fish, we ordered some "Spicy Tuna Poki".  We got a large and tasty salad with a lot of raw tuna mixed in.  And the tempura is some of the best I have had.  We didn't try the Korean food, but I'm sure that it is better than ever now that they don't serve sushi now.

This is one of my favorite places to have lunch. The sushi is fresh and original.  Sara is a wonderful host and her mom is cooking up a storm in the kitchen. 

Try the Michael special, or the salmon asparagus salad! They are awesome.

I've said it before & I'll say it again: This place never disappoints. A delicious Asian cuisine spin with a Korean Japanese fusion & savory western kick, this place is a must try! From the quality of food to the consistently friendly service, I've been here a dozen times & have always had a 5 star experience! 

They start you off with Korean appetizers, giving you kimchee, miso soup & traditional Korean pancakes.

FOR HER: Forever a sushi fan, I absolutely love their LOBSTER ROLL. A crab, cucumber & avocado roll topped with a generous amount of lobster mix and drizzled with eel sauce. ($9.95)

FOR HIM: He ordered a classic SALMON ROLL ($4.95) and the WELL BEING COMBO, which came with beef bulgogi, your choice of salmon or beef kalbi, 3 shrimp tempura, white rice, & chopchae noodles. ($12.95)

PRO TIP: Check in on Yelp & get a free iced green tea or pomegranate tea! ;)

Yummy rolls, delicious Korean dishes, and yeah, really really yummy rolls...Very attentive service. House made kimchi, and all the sake you can drink after 6:00pm. 
They just keep bringing it! WOOO HOOO! 
WOW.

When I saw how low the prices were I was concerned about the quality and complexity. Turned out to be great quality and amazing flavor. Staff was very friendly. Will go back often. Free hot sake after 6 sounds like fun as well.

Thank goodness for yelpers leading me to this hole in the wall. 
The reviews were right on.

 It was an authentic Korean joint with traditional rice/meat dishes. No ji gaes or pan chans.  It's Korean fast food at its finest. 

The restaurant is small, but there is seating available. 
The big added bonus was the free hot sake after 6 pm. 

I got the spicy squid rice bowl. Could've been a little less spicy. 
I enjoyed it overall. 

The service is great. The options are varied enough, and the prices are good!

This is the best traditional Korean food I've had in Las Vegas.  We ordered the arlbap (think bibimbap but with fish eggs instead of beef), nangmyun, salmon skin, roll, and seolleongtang.  The presentation was spot on, the flavors were right, and most of the time when you find a Korean bbq + sushi place you're lacking on one side or the other, but they nailed both! I usually run into an issue where the seolleongtang broth is too watery and it's mostly bone, but this broth was thick and there was plenty of meat.  They make fresh kimchi and their arlbap had plenty of fish eggs and veggies.
Great sushi and great prices with a side of Korean cuisine! I really enjoyed this place! Driven by this place a thousand times and glad I finally st

What a surprising location for a Korean/Sushi restaurant, and we were pleasantly surprised.  Tucked behind popeyes and a gas station, you would've never guessed that a mom/pop Korean restaurant would be located there. 

We came here for dinner and here's what we tried
1.  Spicy seafood noodles (naeng myun) *supposed to come with free sake - Refreshing and spicy chewy cold noodles.  Just what we needed for a hot summer night.  We were slightly disappointed that we didn't get our free sake, but at the same time, we didn't bother asking, again.
2.  Bulgogi box - Unique set up in a Japanese Bento box.  It had macaroni salad, salad, california roll and white rice to accompany the bulgogi on the side on a sizzling platter.  The bulgogi was pretty tasty and I did not mind the extra peppery taste at all.
3.  Deep fried soft shell crab - crunchy and tasty with a drizzle of Japanese mayo?
4.  Pan chan - actually kind of disappointed with the quality of pan chan.  The pickled radish was too soy-sauced and tangy.  The onion/omelette triangles were bland.  The so-called kimchi was just iceberg lettuce tossed in korean chili paste (kochujang).

Conclusion:  It's a very cute hole-in-the wall for quick Korean food without having to go all the way to Chinatown.  The down side is that there are no ji gaes and the pan chan is mediocre at best.

This place changed owners a couple of times since my last review and even though it's okay for take out now & then it isn't as good as it was originally. Tiger roll and bonsai roll are still staples. Always friendly service.

Ordered the Kalbi lunch box special for $9.99 and it was so much food :) being Korean, you can say I know what Kalbi should taste like and thank goodness the owner is Korean so it was perfect. Make sure to come in during the lunch hours 11-3 to get the best prices. I ate with a party of six so maybe that's why the drink refill service was kind of slow, but they turned on their portable AC machine for our side. Had to take my food home since it was too much. Only down side is no music..
Stopped in for first time yesterday, food was amazing. Everything tasted fresh and flavorful. Everyone working these were really nine and friendly can't wait to go back

One of my new favs ! Loved the atmosphere , food and everything. The staff were attentive and friendly. Delish Korean and Japanese food (my two personal favorite cuisines). They have one of the best pancakes in their banchan. I feel it's a bit pricey but at least the fish was super fresh. Will definitely come back again for casual lunch or dinner !
Awesome food ! The service is great . The restaurant is clean and smells good. Wonderful hospitality  , along with a great staff. Food is so wonderful words are not good enough to express

My friend told me this was a great place to have lunch so we headed there with no expectations.

The staff was super friendly and helpful with all the questions we had. We were there in a big group and they answered all of out stupid questions quickly. 
Korean Japanese fusion is a great mix, the Bulgogi was tasty, seafood Bi Bim Bop was delicious, kimchi fried rice was on point but didn't have spam (I'm just used to it being in there) but still good.  

Definitely a good find in Vegas, I look forward to enjoying again when I'm back in town.

This place is odd. Business-wise, they need to do some major overhauling- location is poor, setup is odd, service is lackluster, and that damn sign outside is tacky as hell. (EDIT: they have since removed it, hallelujah!) 
Which is a shame, because this place is great: menu is extensive, sushi is fresh and tasty, and even without the sake special it's well-priced and good value.

Now for the food:
CRAZY EEL ROLL- phenomenal. Giant portion, eel is perfectly cooked, ingredients all work well together. $11, good price for what you receive. Favorite of the night.
PINK ROLL- also good, tons of fresh tuna and salmon, both of which are super fresh and cut thick. Also well priced, think it was a $8-9 roll.
SPIDER ROLL- good presentation, artfully arranged on plate. The crab tasted the slightest bit off, though I blame the batter not the freshness of the fish itself. BF really enjoyed this one.
ALASKA ROLL- This is sushi comfort food to me, salmon and cream cheese are perfect together. Sad they didn't have green onions to add. Surprised they don't keep it in the kitchen for other dishes, and confused because the picture shows the roll topped with shredded onion.
LASAGNA ROLL- not for us, at all. I'm not a fan of baked rolls, but have heard others rave about this one and never tried it. Warm cream cheese is just not my thing, wish we would have just sent this back and had it taken off our check. Did not like at all.

Service was decent and prices are good value- fresh and tasty sushi with great prices. There are only 2 rolls over $11. BF and I spent $60 on the above, plus miso soups for both of us and one free carafe of sake, and had plenty of leftovers.

I've been here a couple times, but those were before my time on Yelp. I went recently with my sister and husband. 

We were seated right away and our drink order was taken and delivered promptly. The service is very polite and friendly. 

I ordered the duk bok hi (spicy rice cake), which can be somewhat hard to find if you don't know where to look - but apparently more places are offering this on their menu. I got the plain order, with just rice cake. It was $5.95 for a generous serving and the flavor was good. The duk (rice cake) was a little soft for my taste, indicating maybe a little bit over cooked. Regardless, it was still good. The spice level was great, too.

I also ordered the Crazy Eel Roll (mis-spelled on their menu as the Carzy Eel). I believe the roll was around $10.95, and it was definitely worth it! The flavor was great, and it was a HUGE roll. Those two items definitely filled me up!

My sister ordered a roll as well, I forget what the name was, but it was also very big and she said it was great tasting, too (I was too full of my own food to even try, but it looked good!). 

If I lived on this side of town, I would be in so much trouble because I would be eating here ALL THE TIME!

We didn't have to wait for refills and the server made sure to check on us often, even without needing to refill any drinks.

I have to say this place is good for Korean Fast food. Price is decent. I got the Bbq beef box. Meat was pretty good with good flavor. The service was attentive. 

However, I also got the Mandu (dumplings) and it wasn't good at all! No flavor and the dipping sauce sucked. So Im torned on how I liked this place. Hence, the 3 stars.

Went to this place on yelp reviews and Im glad that we did! Our server was very friendly and accomodating considering we came in with our 1 year old she brought him miso soup with rice mixed in (and we didn't even ask for it) The sushi was very good and fresh and there bento boxes are very filling and delicious. Ill for sure be coming here again! After 6 pm they serve free  hot sake :0)

All their bentos are excellent. The Spicy sashimi bibimbop I feel is overrated (too much rice compared to fish chunks without any real wow factor). Their cabbage kimchi is always good; it's a nice alternative to the traditional napa cabbage version.

To be honest, I've only ordered out, and most of the time, I only get the Spicy Tuna Poki Salad.  It's a nice light lunch, but packed full of flavour.  I wasn't impressed by the sushi.  The rolls were anemic and uninspired.  I can't ding them too much, though, because I wouldn't come here for sushi in the first place.  Their lunch specials are plentiful, and again, their Poki Salad is to die for.
Excellent. Inexpensive place, friendly stuff and quick service. I will come here often

Clean and cute little restaurant. Very friendly and attentive waitress (who I think may be one of the owners?). Reasonable prices. Delicious food. No complaints!

The side dishes (kimchee and veggie pancake) tasted very fresh and were delicious! The menu is a little more on the Japanese side than Korean. We ordered spicy tuna roll, udon noodle soup, and a bento with chicken and beef. Udon noodle soup was simple but very tasty. The chicken and beef were well flavored. We were surprised at first that they didn't come with a teriyaki-type sauce (which you come to expect with meats in bento boxes), but after tasting realized they did not need it, and it's healthier that way too!

Big fan. Will be back!

I have passed by this place numerous times, generally on my way to and from the Nevada Chicken Co that's nearby. Never tried it before because I was a bit skeptical about the name (Well Being in a Box?) and the small location.

To vary my protein sources from Chicken and Beef, I tried finding a good place for raw tuna and salmon...and lo and behold, I found that place at the WBB!

Now I go every wendesday and get a plate of their fresh salmon salad and spicy tuna poke...and they are both so very fresh and tasty! About $7 bucks a piece and enough meat to satisfy my cravings. And the poke varies a bit in taste from other places I've got it...but a good varience because the flavor is awesome.

And the last time I went, they brought out my salmon salad and told me they cut me thicker slices of salmon (same amount of slabs too...just thicker) and said they did so since I like their salmon so much! Very cool

I think I found a keeper...and I love when that happens
A very simple review. The service is genuine, the food is great quality for the price, and the menu is simple yet full. Highly recommended! Combo box lunch special!!! Go!!!
If you are looking for decor or ambiance, skip it. If you are looking for great sushi rolls, Korean dishes, excellent service, and free sake, this is the place.

When I heard about Well Being in A Box, it made me smile a little.  When I left the place, I had a full blown grin. I'm a sucker for bento boxes (or combination plates), cheap meals and pleasant dining experiences and this tiny joint checks all those boxes for me.  For the prices, you are getting an excellent deal with large portions.  Not mind blowing fare, but they definitely hit the spot.  Plus, service rocked.

We had the Kalbi bento box which comes with Kalbi, green salad, cucumber salad, macaroni salad, rice, 2 pc crab roll; the chicken katsu bowl; the Kamikaze roll (spicy tuna topped with eel and avocado) and the Alaskan roll (I think, it's California maki topped with salmon).  The eel was delicious and cut thicker than the salmon, but both were of good quality.  The rolls were priced between $8-10 and had 8 large pieces per order!  They also serve complimentary banchan - freshly made kimchi, potato pancakes and pickled radish.  We had serious food comas when we left.  

So next time you are hankering for cheap Korean-Japanese fare, swing by this quirky joint and see if it satisfies your cravings too!  

P.S. This place would've had 5 stars if the Chicken Katsu wasn't over-fried. In case this happens to you, I'm sure they'll be willing to redo it for you.  We were just too hungry lazy to ask. :P

Love their kalbi.  They have a good selection of lunch specials (between 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.).  I usually order the kalbi bento box which comes with the kalbi, rice, salad, macaroni salad, two pieces of california roll and miso soup.  Not sure what type of salad dressing they use but love it.  They'll usually give you a couple banchan such as kimchi or pickled radish if you eat in.  Meat Jun and Chop Chae are also good too.

I usually go during the day and service has been great everytime.  Prices are reasonable and I've always enjoyed my meal.  Just thinking of their kalbi is making me hungry.  Definitely worth a try.

tldr

Quiet, small, quaint spot with very friendly service.
The main server, Smiley, was very personable and accommodating.

Get:
-well being combo (comes w/ 3 shrimp tempura, scoop of rice, chopchae, beef bulgogi, choice of beef kalbi or salmon)
-lobster roll

Protip: their lunch specials from 11am-3pm is clutch and less than $10.

First let me state that the service is excellent. The women serving us were beyond nice, even when I told them I was given the wrong food, they replaced it and were sooo nice about it. 

Complimentary mini appetizers, and not to mention they're endless! Great kimchi and amazing vegetable pancakes (highly recommended). I didn't try the radish in ginger. They also gave complimentary watermelon at the end of our meal. 

I ordered the chicken Katsu in tonkatsu sauce and it was the best chicken katsu I've had in Vegas. It comes with rice, sushi, ginger, sliced cucumber, macaroni salad and, a salad with peanut dressing. I only give four stars because I wasn't crazy over the salad, it had too much dressing. Also the macaroni salad was a little bland. 

Overall it was great. I'll definitely be returning, such a pleasant meal.

New owners are in their 2nd week of service as if this review. 
Service was attentive and kind.
The seafood sashimi bowl  ($12) was excellent and generous in portions which included 4 different varieties including tuna, yellowtail, salmon and shrimp. It also contained lettuce, radish, and asian pears. 
We also ordered the lunch special We love mom doshirak ($9).  It had bulgogi, chicken katsu, pickled garlic stems, Mac salad and one other korean side. It was ambitious but a little lacking. 
The new owners seemed to give more side dishes korean pancakes, Kim chee, da moo Ji, pickled radish in soy sauce and jalepenos. 
For dessert they gave us 4 pieces of watermelon. 
They also honored the yelp free ice tea deal without a hitch. 
A solid 4 1/2 star experience.
I love the spicy ramen with shrimp tempura special. I've been craving this place lately

Great lunch menu with awesome selection and specialties.

One thing I like about this place a lot is that they mix up their lunch menu regularly. They offer some amazing deals and a whole variety of stuff, such as spaghetti shrimp with don-katsu. Whaaaa? Yeah you never know with this place, but it's definitely always good.

If you want to stick with the regulars, there's plenty to choose from on their lunch menu. I personally like the Mom's Dosirak, which is served with a variety of meat, salad, rice and soup. It's a filling deal for around $10. Also their don-katsu dish is enormous. It reminds me of some of the don-katsu I had in L.A. and it tastes great too. They also have seafood bibimbap (hwae-dup-bap) which I recommend as well.

They do take-out orders as well and the waiting time is never that long, roughly ten minutes or so. The interior is a simple contemporary look that's nothing fancy, but charming to say the least. Overall, great lunch destination! PS I hear they have free sake after 6pm. You can't beat free booze!

OMG where to begin? This restaurant is truly a hidden gem on the outskirts of Sin City. First off the staff were attentive and really helpful. I was suggested the Korean short rib lunch combo and was not disappointed! The rolls were excellent as well. Would definitely recommend to all the individuals looking to fulfill their sushi or Korean bbq cravings!

We come from a place where Asian cuisine is spectacular, where it's cooked by people who can't speak a word of English but make the most exquisite Asian cuisine.  When we moved to the states, we were expecting to find better food out here, since the states promises better and bigger things.

We tried the great Asian restaurants in the Venetian, the Forums, and every other place you can think of.  Even the locals suggested a few asian buffets, but to our dismay the food was just "okay", and not the great flavors I sought.

One day, out of sheer luck, we passed by this restaurant and finally decided to stop in.  Walking in felt like home; the counter in the front, the nice, homely tables around the sides, and the music just like the stuff played over the speakers at the Chinese and Japanese restaurants where we're from.

The service, for a small restaurant, is impeccable.  Not only are they there to give you refills without asking, but the food comes out fast and extremely well plated.  Our first experience here happened to be what we've sought--great sushi.  We tried their tempura sushi and tuna, and to our amazement, we were finally home.

Their culinary delights include their fabulous tempura that, in all honesty, beats the hotel restaurants and buffets on and off the strip.  Theirs is real tempura--light, crispy batter, perfectly brown and very well seasoned.  Their bulgogi, kalbi, and barbecue chicken is a delight.  If you order anything that comes with a special box, you must eat their macaroni and regular salad.  Even their miso soup is excellent.  Compared to a five star restaurant at home, this place is up there.

I'm not exxagerating when I say that this is the best Japanese and Korean food in Vegas.  It honestly is, and if you want a taste of real Japanese and Korean food is, you MUST eat here.  

Since my discovery of this place, we eat here every day for dinner, and we will continue to because their food is the best in Vegas.  Hands down.

Well Being In The Box is an awesome tucked away gem! There are Korean and sushi options on the extensive menu. Plus beer and wine. 
I ordered the bibimbap and it did not disappoint. Huge serving with tons of ingredients over a bed of fluffy rice. I also enjoyed the house made kimchi. Crisp and delicious. All the ingredients were fresh!

Really like this place. I've had the lunch specials, tasty at a good price. Recently my coworkers and I placed a huge sushi order. They had it ready in a timely manner and thru in extra appetizers. Delicious food and great friendly service.

I lucked upon Well Being in the Box.  I was doing a clinical rotation at Rawson Neal Psych Hospital, about 2 blocks away, and a social worker mentioned the place.  

We arrived with 8 people and only had 50 minutes.  We mentioned this to the staff and he said they could do it.  We ordered 6 plates of sushi, 3 rolls, 5 plates of food and were out in 45 minutes.  IMPRESSIVE!

The sushi was very good, tender and fresh, the spicy shrimp was fantastic, and whatever the dressing is they use of the salad is amazing.  The seating was good.  Only thing I would mention as an improvement is some music.  Prices were very good.  I look forward to sampling more of the menu next time we are up there.
Cold food, cold soup, poor service, and the flavors not that good. I wonder how this place got the four stars that it currently has...

This is such a awesome place. The service is exceptional. The food was so tasty and fresh. The pictures I posted do not do the food justice. The restaurant is super clean, the bathroom was well stocked and sanitary. I will be back here!!

I stopped in to grab lunch to go, after already having A Day--hungry and mopey, it was an act of will not to really destroy myself and follow my nose to Popeye's. So glad I stopped here. The menu is extensive, everything is reasonable, and the guys behind the counter were friendly. I was intrigued by their bulgogi and kalbi, but got a Spicy Pork Bowl: slices of marinated pork, scallions, sauteed onions and chili sprinkles (there's a name for these, but I don't know it) over white rice. The pork was juicy and had a pleasant chili kick, balanced nicely by the semi-sticky rice. They served up a nice-sized portion. That, plus an iced tea was less than $10. For good, fresh food that isn't flavored by preservatives and fryer grease? Can't be beat.
We are hooked.   Been here three times now and love it.   The food is fabulous.   My son loves the eel,  husband loves everything.   Love the presentation.

I would give it 10 stars if I could. We went here last week and it was absolutely amazing! Excellent service and delish korean food and sushi. Wish they could be open longer though :/ my family was there earlier than me and I came in late since I just got off work. It was already 30 min. before they close. But nonetheless, I loved the experience. Will come back again!
Will be back here for sure! Amazing little friendly restaurant! Menu is to die for! And I am a very picky sushi eater! Give this place a try!

while on a recent trip to vegas with my family, we stopped by here for an early lunch. my parents, my dad specifically, is a true korean man; he needs rice for at least one meal a day.

what i ate:
- well being bento box: salmon, bulgogi, japchae, tempura: this was soooo worth the $15 price tag. the plate was IMMENSE! filled with food. everything on it was very tasty, and there was probably enough food for two people. my only gripe with the food is that the japchae and the bulgogi were very similar. the only difference between the two was that the bulgogi had meat, and japchae had noodles instead. my suggestion is to just keep the bulgogi to meat and onions, because the added bell peppers, while very very nice in flavor, makes the bulgogi taste exactly the same as the japchae since it's the same veggies. 

pros:
- wide assortment of food on the menu. while there is korean style japanese food, there is also straight korean food too
- reasonably priced! we ordered 5 menu items, and with tax and tip it came out to about $75?$80? and we were ALL stuffed to the brim
- server was very very sweet and patient
- clean and quiet restaurant... but, is that normal? the restaurant was very empty :( such a shame as it's yummy place
- plenty of parking in front

cons:
- not on the strip
- it's kind of in between a homey mom and pop restaurant, and a to go place. 
- small, though the server was nice to put two table together so that my family would sit together. 

would i come again? sure, if i was in the mood for korean style japanese food.

I...LOVE....THIS...PLACE!  I truly cannot say enough. The food is terrific, the servers are pleasant and attentive and the prices are VERY reasonable.  

My boss had been trying to get my to try this place for several months but I resisted which was truly my bad.

We were feeling down yesterday, so the fiance wanted to go somewhere as a foodie distraction. Good food really does take away from the negatives in life. We walk in to this somewhat divey hole-in-the-wall around 6:30pm, eyeing the unkempt decor and overall awkwardness of the restaurant setup. Very awkward for a first-time visit. However, our waitress was very kind and incredibly quick. She was eager to help and seat us with menus, and, when you settle, the environment is pretty relaxed. 
 
The food is definitely 5/5. The downside is in the decor, as well as the fact that basically everything in their bathroom in pretty much non-functional. Other than that, the food was awesome. Everything was fresh, good on temp, and fully cooked (save the sashimi, lol). Fiance ordered the Chicken Fried Rice and the Lobster Role. I took the risk and dove straight for the Hwe Doh Bahp (Sashimi bowl with rice and greens). Wow. What as serving. A little pricey, but if you really think about what you're getting, then everything totals out.

The Chicken Fried Rice was really good. Large chunks of chicken, pan fried I assume.   Tons of veggies, crisp bean sprouts, green onion, plus some. Fried to perfection, steaming hot in the bowl, and great presentation. Not spicy, but a little warning on the heat when it first arrives. 

The Hwe Doh Bahp was amazing. I fully intend to return just to have it again. Fresh fish, perfectly cut, cold sashimi in a bed of warm rice under greens and sprouts. Flavorful enough, but a little soy sauce and Sriracha on the side should make it absolutely perfect (in my opinion). The fish is smooth, tasted exactly right, and had the beautiful texture we often look for in good sashimi. Did mention that it's gorgeous? 

The Lobster Roll was very tasty. A lot of good flavor from the fish and lobster itself. A great roll with that extra bite of shrimp to really brighten you tastebuds. Not spicy, somewhat casual, and very good. 

Overall, the experience itself was good. Food is phenomenal. I will definitely return, but the environment is just a tad bit uncomfortable. Nonetheless, the food is definitely worthwhile. That's really what matters when you share it with company.

This place is truly amazing! The food is so tasty and the portions are so big we had to box most of it up and take it home. 
We ordered the Udon soup which I really enjoyed, but what I liked most was the salmon and asparagus salad (seriously YUM) and the kimchee and pancakes they serve was so delicious!!
Our waitress was so sweet and very attentive. Thanks guys for amazing food and service.

If you like Korean food, you must go to Well Being!   If you like healthy food, but haven't gone to Well Being yet, you are about to die.  Everything I've had has been excellent and the service is fast an friendly.  Highly recommend the spicy sashimi bibimbob!  The sushi is great and the bulgogi is excellent!  Enjoy!!!

Ok let's review...
Addicting salad dressing
Tasty sushi
Tender n juicy kalbi ribs
Crispity crunchity soft japacalamari 
"fwee" sake after 6pm?
What else do u need? Some disco lights, a DJ, some sake bombs, we have a partay! Eric, let's make this happen dood!

Try it, you'll like it....

I DO! 

Keep on yelping, don't stop....!

C

This place is amazing!! They were about to leave when we showed up, but they stayed to make our sushi because it was my birthday. They were SO kind and fast. The sushi was excellent quality as well, I can't think of a single negative point. Also it's super nice to hear them speaking in Japanese behind the counter since sushi is Japanese cuisine!! I love this place so much, I'm definitely gonna become a regular there :3

Have you ever wanted to eat at your parent's house and wished they were Korean and cooked good ol' Korean food? Well, bip-ba-di-bam! Wish granted. (Except of course you have to pay...errhm...)

With that being said, the place is a little tricky to find but worth the effort. The owner is super nice and friendly. The atmosphere is cozy without being tight and the place is kept pretty clean. I went there with my family for an afternoon lunch and was courteously greeted even though it was kind of busy. Service was quick and you never felt rushed. 

We each ordered something different. They ordered things like the fried rice, Chop Chee, and Sushi Box, while I went straight for the jugular and ordered the BBQ Kalbi Box. The fried rice was on par for a decent chinese take out, the chop chee was good, and the sushi was surprisingly good for a non-sushi joint, strictly speaking. The show stealer was the Kalbi though. By the way, it comes with like a thousand sides. (Really 4-5 and they're all tasty, except the macaroni salad which tasted like...macaroni salad.) It didn't sound like much food but we were all full at the end and all for under 30 for 4 people. Not too shabby at all. It's a great place if you want quick service and something simple. Definitely give it a try!
Such a cute and small place. Friendly staff, great service. Beer, sushi, awesome lunch specials. They do take out and dine in as well. The lobster roll was super yummy and don't leave without mochi!

What happened?

My favorite place lost some stars:(  

Bummer!  

Glad I didn't bring any new guests on this visit. 

They must have gotten a new chef?

Ordered the Korean box (Bilgogi) which came with a side salad, mini Cali roll and macaroni salad.  Sorry to say the bilgogi was bland and dry. Very disappointed.  It came with a Miso soup and it was never brought out?  Mac salad was also bland. They always bring out some little appetizers and those were tasteless as well.  

Service was good but music was terrible.  

The hubby was disappointed with his meal too. 

Hope they get it together this was my favorite spot:(

This place gets 5 stars on their customer service alone!!! The food gets another 5 stars!!! It's family owned so another 5 stars!!! 5's across the board. They're very lenient on substituting, if you're someone like me who doesn't like sushi. I love this little place.

Well Being's in a Box Sushi,
2555 S Jones Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89146.

I would give five stars.. The food and service was incredible and sushi came right out. When I told them I was dining in I was given a spread. Spider roll was trying to crawl out the sides! Price was under twenty before tip. Great experience!

Damon_Reeder@yahoo.com

I really love this place. Lately I've been craving Korean food on a regular, and there are so many tasty sounding dishes offered here. 
Every time I've come in , Jamie has helped me. She is super friendly and offered refills on my rice, soups, and side dishes. Not to mention she's soo adorably cute.

My favorite dish is their spicy sashimi bibimbop. It's served on a bed of white rice & shredded lettuce, topped white tuna, salmon and yellowtail sashimi. There's also some sesame dressing and crispy white noodles in the mix. They give you some spicy sauce on the side to make it as more/less spicy as you want.

The side of the restaurant is fairly small but quiet--which I like because I can sit there and study in peace.

Decided to check out WBiTB after reading lots of great yelp reviews. I ordered the Mushroom soup with dumplings. There were at least three different kinds of mushrooms (enoki, and two others I can't name) and lots of them! The dumplings were gyoza style, and obviously homemade. really light, fresh taste, all garnished with green onion and shredded carrot. $14 seems a little bit pricy for a bowl of soup, given that most of the menu items were $10 or less, but I can't complain about the quality. Really tasty stuff, filling but not heavy. The service was very warm and friendly as well. I'll definitely be back, and I'm looking forward to trying the rest of their menu offerings.

Excellent Korean Japanese fusion food.
I went with the Meat Jun Box and was really impressed with the food. Good flavor and such friendly service. The nice Korean lady that helped me was on point with the service.
Would definitely come back here for lunch again

I really like this place! Very friendly and customer service oriented. This was my first time so I tried the chicken box. Yummy and great portion size. I also tried some of the house udon soup....delish. I will be back to try some of the sushi.

Well Being in the Box is a great place for some awesome Korean and Asian fusion food. The portions are quite large, and the price is cheap compared to other Korean restaurants. Some dishes only run for $4! I definitely recommend the sashimi bibbimbab. The fish is always fresh and super tasty. I don't think you can go wrong venturing off and trying something new here because everything is great. I always have a pleasant experience here because the servers are very friendly and attentive. Definitely a great place to try!

Came here looking for sushi, and a place that was open at 10am, loved the name! Sushi prices are a little steep, but the box combos are great!! They also bring these little egg green onion squares and (homemade?) Kimchi. Mmmm that was really good. Probably be back again!

Oh, and the service is fantastic!

My friends, who are Korean, really liked this place.  I especially like their chilled noodles dish, which was really refreshing on a hot summer day.  I had some kind of spicy chicken dish as my main dish; but it was overcooked and dry.  However, everything else was pretty good.  I'll probably go back and try something else besides the dry, overcooked spicy chicken dish I had before.

I came here two times over the past two weeks to get a fix on my Kal-bi cravings! The first time was after my dentist appointment I had the Kal-bi box to go. I was so delighted when I got home and opened the box . It had rice, salad, cucumber salad, macaroni salad and four pieces of sushi. Then a whole new box for the Kal-bi. 

The Kal- bi was nice and tender and it was a very generous portion. Once I tasted it ...instantly crave worthy ! I love the salad that comes with the meal because the dressing is very tasty. I'd love to know how they make it. I like it better than some places that make their dressing with the minced Ginger. The macaroni salad is good but different ..it has more of a buttery taste to it. The rolls that come with the meal are okay but it tastes like they've been sitting out for a bit. The box is filling and it includes veggies so you don't have to feel too guilty about all the meat you just ate! 

The second time I came with my hubby I was afraid I wasn't going to be able to find him something that he will eat and enjoy. He found Spaghetti on the menu but he was told that they discontinued it and it will not be on their new menu. Then I found the Kal-bi salad which I thought would be perfect because it has the same idea as Thai Beef Salad which he loves. This comes with the creamy dressing so it's different then a Thai Beef salad but he says he likes the Kal-bi salad better. It was good because they topped the salad with Kal-bi and more of that creamy dressing! 

This place is hidden behind a Popeyes chicken but it's well worth the excursion!

Strange name for a restaurant. I got the sashimi bibimbap. It was good, and for the price, there was a decent amount of sashimi. The servers were friendly, and the meal was only $10.95.....pretty good value. I'll be back, and I'll probably try their sushi.

I like this place. Their crunch roll is really good and the last time i visited their special right now. I am disappointed they got rid of their iced coffee, but it is a sushi restaurant. Other items on their menu is of course great as well. Overall, i'd recommend this place for anyone.

This is little Korean/sushi restaurant with a nice selection of seafood items. The service is great. The owner takes care of the restaurant with pride and dies her best to provide good service. 

I ordered the spicy Sashimi Bibimbap which was a huge plate. The dish had three different types of fish, radish, rice and lettuce. We also had the Buldogi Bowl which was also a good size portion. The meat was well cooked and had good flavor.
Dont forget to check in with your yelp app and get your free green tea! 

Overall, I really liked this restaurant. The fish was super fresh, the service was good and the taste of the food was awesome!

Came here from across town after seeing it on yelp and to start we will definitely be back great service good prices and really good tastes so far. It's not a place you would think much of without trying since it looks a bit "eh" from the outside. The lunch special prices are all  under$10 and there's a ton of great options with good portions. 
We ordered the Kalbi plate, spicy chicken plate, bulgogi box, edamame, and ahi poki. 
The ahi poke was $8 but was a really nicely sized portion with really good ahi. It was a really nice twist to poke since it had seaweed, cabbage, and fish roe it in with a slight spicy taste. Definitely worth getting! 
The spicy chicken plate first off comes on the biggest plate I've ever seen in my life. I personally really liked it not at all a taste you get a lot of. The perfect description of it is hot fries flavored chicken. I loved it and I'm not usually a spicy person. 
The beef bolgogi was a smaller portion than I would've liked but for $9 it's not bad. Typical bulgogi taste and not overly marinated. 
The Kalbi was extremely good very tender and perfectly cooked. 
Got an order of shrimp shumai half way through our meal. It was pretty good although I've never really had it before so I don't have any comparison. 
All in all I will be telling everyone about this place and their amazing hot fries spicy chicken it's really a must have. Everything was really good and the service was great they were super friendly and very attentive of our 8 month old daughter which is always nice.

Misled by Yelpers and beautiful food pictures :(  At 4.5 stars and 90 reviews, we were looking forward to trying this place.  

Beef SoonDubu  (spicy tofu soup) was overpowering with black pepper and none of the usual rich broth flavors (calm jus instead of plain beef broth with black pepper).

My husband had the bibimbap sashimi rice bowl.  The server brought it and said she changed out the tuna for albacore because it is "more better".  When he told her that he loves tuna and would rather have that, she then says "Oh. We are out of tuna."  The chunks of red snapper were frozen solid (couldn't bite through).  The albacore were presliced, frozen, and was thawing in the bowl.

Appetizer dishes: 2 only, kimchi, and doughy pancakes.  Kimchi was good.

Overall, the quality of ingredients was mediocre but ultimately there was a total lack of flavor in every dish and it was neither good Korean nor Japanese food.  The rice was my favorite part of the meal.
Nice owners and good tasting food. The prices are very reasonable, and the service is speedy. Comes highly recommended.

This place is really close to my work.  I have actually called them before and see if they have a menu that they could fax to my office.  They said no menu available.  I then asked them if they have lunch specials, and all they said was "We have rice for lunch special."  Not to be rude, but if you can't market what you are trying to sell, I don't think I want to waste my time with you.  I blacklisted this place after that phone conversation. 

A month later, they dropped off menus at my office.  Ok, maybe things are about to change.  So my co worker and I decided to order some food for lunch.  Free delivery for orders over $25. 

I ordered two salmon hand rolls, one spicy tuna roll, macaroni salad and three orders of sushi.  I must give credit to the gal on the phone for suggesting that I shouldn't get the yellowtail sushi today - honesty works for me. 

So the order came out to be $27.81 for our order.  Here I was excited about my salmon hand rolls, thinking they are going to pretty HAND ROLLS.  They delivered the food within ten minutes, awesome.  But it was so disappointing to see my hand rolls were actually cut rolls wrapped in seaweed.  I don't care if they are Koreans, but they should know the difference between cut rolls and hand rolls...!  

The macaroni salad tasted kind of refrigerator-y.  Yuck!!  The spicy tuna roll was definitely spicy but I don't think it was because of the spicy tuna.  They just dump this spicy sauce on the rice - I couldn't even see the spicy tuna! 

The fish on the sushi was ok... nothing spectacular or that fresh... 

Overall, a quick lunch would be good for this place if you know what to order, but I definitely would not recommend anyone to eat here for an experience. 

Eaters beware.

This was our first time here. My wife got the lunch combo Bento box thing, and I was in the mood for sushi so I had a dragon roll and I got us a salmon skin roll to share.

Yeah so we ended up sharing everything.

I didn't realize it came with other stuff, but she also brought us some miso soup and kimchi and even a Korean pancake to try.

The pancake was fresh and hot and delicious. It was softer than I expected. I've had it only once before at the Korean supermarket on spring mountain, but that one was old and dry. This one was fresh and awesome.

Their sushi had imitation crab, which was no surprise, but I wasn't too crazy about it. This particular batch of crab seemed a little watery and tasteless. However the unagi was really good and the salmon skin roll was just about the best thing I've ever eaten since moving to Vegas a few months ago.

It was my first time having salmon skin roll. If you've never had it, you really got to try it. It was so amazing! It's like healthy omega-3 bacon or something. Seriously you got to try it.

The lunch combo was good too. I was getting full from sushi, so I only tasted the chicken and the kalbi. Both were delicious, but that kalbi was so tender and awesome. I might end up getting that next time we go back.

Service was excellent too. The lady was very friendly. And the restaurant itself was very bright and clean, at least near the windows where we were sitting. It was a very good experience overall.

We'll be back.

Update review! My husband and I ate here last week. There were a lot of tables that were unoccupied and even if there's other customers, our server was very attentive and bubbly. They gave us complimentary drinks and dessert. We ordered the kalbi box but instead of steamed rice, we wanted kimchi fried rice, she made it happen (two thumbs up!) it came in a sizzling plate sitting under fresh onions and it was so so so good! We left a pretty good amount of tip because she deserved it. 

As previously stated, I'm still pretty shocked this place isn't packed. Food is delicious and healthy, restaurant is clean, pretty small but well maintained, and the staff are always super nice. We'll be coming back soon and bringing other family members so they can try for themselves. 

Oh and not to mention the food they serve is a lot that we were not able to eat our main entree there, we were so full from the appetiZer that we had to take it home. That $15 box was worth it.

Just had dinner with the fam and had a great delicious meal!  Portions were large, prices reasonable and the food fresh and tasty.  The Pink roll (spicy tuna roll wrapped in a thick fresh slice of salmon) was huge and only $8. We even received a complimentary dish of tempura fried salmon and asparagus salad that was amazing. The owner and his sister run the restaurant and you can tell the food is made with heart, not to mention that the service is great.

Stop in with family in town, they (my bro) say it is busy at lunch,,, no so busy at dinner while we were there... Ordered well being combo, salmon was either frozen or old, tasted bad, did not eat the second piece and no takers on the table. My cousin ordered the Kalbi beef, need the sauce like they have at a Hawaiian places, needed a little flavoring... But  food priced reasonable 
Waitress was fast and attentive, food is ok, better to order the specials next time.. Parking is readily available

Despite the fact that I did not have a huge sampling of what the menu offers, I am more than willing to give Well Being 4 stars for two reasons:

1. Free Hot Sake after 6pm: You would think this would mean one little sake cup's worth, but you get a carafe, and the waitress repeatedly asks if you need more!
2. The waitress repeatedly asks you if you want more sake (which means that the service is amazing)! The friendliest of service, very concerned about your happiness and well-being.

My udon was good and only $6. I wish it came with a couple of pieces of tempura, but I can live without it. My wingman had a Crazy Eel roll, and he said it was great.

The menu has a lot of sushi, some Korean specialties and Japanese entrees, such as Katsu. There are not a lot of options for vegetarians unfortunately. Still, I think for meat-eaters and sake-lovers, Well-Being is a real charming little place and definitely worth a try!

After venturing to try some more food from this menu, I was very pleasantly surprised! I love the Bi-Bim-Bop, it  is out of this world! Sushi is very fresh. I am really glad I tried a more variety of the food from the menu and not just the lunch specials. Service is also extremely quick and friendly! I highly recommend this place!
Friendly and clean, food is yummy I will make this place a regular stop when I crave for Japanese or Korean food!

"What's in the box???"   "What's in the box???"    

Unfortunately for Brad Pitt, it ended up being Gwyneth Paltrow's head (spoiler alert!) and not well-being, but close enough right?   I don't think he shoots Kevin Spacey (spoiler alert!) if the box contained Kalbi and rice.  

So I've ventured to Well Being in the Box (WBITB) a couple of times the last few weeks.  The first time was mainly to get a take out menu as I couldnt find a good representation online anywhere.  My friend and I placed an order and waited for it.   The service while waiting was incredible!  I ordered an iced green tea and they gave us two.   They also gave us a free order of a Korean Omelet since my friend had asked about it.  The woman there was welcoming of any questions and was making suggestions during our entire visit.   

I ordered a "Sushi Plate" lunch special, which ended up containing 8 (I think) pieces of Nigiri of differing variety.   To be honest, the quality on the fish wasn't spectacular except for the Salmon, but it wasn't bad either and I still ate the entire plate (not a surprise if you've read any of my other reviews).   One downside for doing take out was they only provided one small packet of soy sauce.   I don't think they were intentionally stingy with it, but 2-3 would have been much more sufficient.

The next time I tried the BBQ Combo Plate.  This had a nice sized portion of Chicken and Kalbi, along with some rice, salad (like Leslie Knope, "I stand by my decision to avoid salad and other disgusting things."), and two pieces of a California Roll.   I found this meal to be much more pleasing than the sushi plate.  Both the Kalbi and Chicken were delicious with the rice, the California Roll was a California Roll, and I gave the salad to my pet rabbits.    The price was right for the full meal @ 8.95.

All in all, I'd probably give the food a 3, but the service is good enough to warrant a bump up to a 4.

I think this is a hugely underrated place.  It's in a really bad spot on the southwest block at Sahara and Jones.  I haven't tried the sushi...  I think more of this place as a Korean restaurant that serves sushi.  I usually order the Korean stuff.  It comes with the entree, rice, a maccaroni salad, green salad, and 4 pieces of a California roll.  Most of the boxes are under $10 except for the kalbi and bulgogi.  I usually go there to order the meat jun (egg battered fried beef).
I usually get take out here, but the few times I've dined in I've gotten the typical Korean side dishes.  I remember them being okay.  I think there was this kim chi pancake thing that was good.
Is this the best Korean food in Vegas?  Probably not.  But the food is good and quick and a lot cheaper than the other Korean places.

I went here for a quick lunch with the coworkers and tried their bbq chicken/kalbi lunch combo.  For the amount of food you get and what you pay....I would give it a 3 stars.  But in terms of flavor profiles...they were almost non-existent.  There is a macaroni salad served with the bento style box...that was very bland.  The chicken itself was very dry and overcooked and lacked any flavor.  I actually had to request a side of teriyaki sauce to add some flavor to the meat.  The kalbi was tender, but very similar to a home made version that is just meh in terms of flavor.  The meal also comes with soup,salad, 2 pieces of california roll, and banchan...so that is a bonus.  Based on what my coworker said the rolls here may be the better option or I noticed an older Korean couple ordering a cold Korean noodle dish that looked legit.  The owners are Korean....so the traditional Korean dishes may be the best bet here.

The food was ok but tricky advertising.
The sign out side says in small letters salmon and then %50 off sushi in big letters.  You think everything is %50 off it's only order of salmon sushi.  Vary tricky advertising.  So we won't go back!

Went to Korea years ago and really liked the food.  This place is simple and manages to do it well enough to bring back some great memories.
Will be back again.

Their service is great, noticed that their business is pretty blow. First time coming here & I wanted to order the beef spicy soup. But unfortunately they didn't have it so I order the Kalbi spicy soup & caterpillar rolls to go. Everything was delicious. I was kind of disappointed with the quantity of the beef. I paid almost $11 for one beef.. I mean the soup was delicious I just wish there was more meat in the soup I ordered. But other than that I would come here again.

Wonderful little Japanese/Korean restaurant.  I love the name of the restaurant "Well Being in the Box."  We ordered a whole bunch of food.

- Free kimchi and daikon
- Spicy Shrimp Platter - delicious shrimp in a red sauce that was a little spicy - came with a macaroni salad, a green salad and rice
- Beef Kalbi Bento Box - very tender beef kalbi - came with macaroni salad, 2 pcs of sushi, green salad
- Chicken Benton Box - similar to beef kalbi except with chicken
- Seafood pancake (Pajeon) - quite well done - I liked this dish
- Steamed mandoo - these little dumpling gems were so delicious with the dumpling dipping sauce

The owner found out that we heard about the restaurant on yelp and also that we were from Canada.  She brought us a dish of different types of mochi!  Such a nice lady and asked us to come back again.  

We will be back!
I went here for lunch and it was okay.  The server was friendly and nice but the food was very forgettable.  I don't think I'll be back any time soon.

Took forever to get our order in. Had to retake our order after 20 minutes of waiting. Then our order was messed up again. Looks like only one person working the front. All in all, it took the server 4 tries to get our order right. No one at the table got their food at the same time so we ended up waiting even longer for everyone to finish. Service sucked. Food was average.

Drove by this place but never gave it a second thought because of the uninviting exterior. Finally, one of my coworkers brought me here for lunch and I am so glad that he did. Service is a bit slow, but the food is well worth the wait.

Good korean/japanese food for the price. It's clean and the owner is such a sweet heart and so personable. The sushi is nothing special, but their box dinners ie: kalbi (korean bbq) and bulgogi are good for the price. I've been here about 5 times now and still stand by their hae-doh-bap which is probably the best restaurant haedohbap i've ever had. The owner told me she was actually going to open up a haedohbap place in Korea before coming to America and so has done extensive research even outside of Vegas in LA and Korea to find out what makes it good. Paid off. It's yummy! try it out. It's not bad at all.

Service: friendly & fast.

Food: delicious.  Good serving sizes. PLENTY of choices from cut rolls, hand rolls, teriyaki, tempura'd veggies & shrimps, down to Korean bbq short ribs.  You can't go wrong with the Korean bbq short ribs. 

Prices: fair, especially for the portion/serving sizes. 

Parking: plentiful. Such a plus!
